section.name: Propertycopy
section.p: Copies the value of a named property to another property. This is useful when you need to plug in the value of another property in order to get a property name and then want to get the value of that property name.

tr.td: The name of the property to set.
If the property is already set, should we change it's value. Can be true or false
The name of the property to set.
No. Use the property attribute instead
The name of the property you wish to copy the value from.
Do you want to suppress the error if the "from" property does not exist, and just not set the property "name".

subsection.name: Example
subsection.source: <property name="org" value="MyOrg"/> <property name="org.MyOrg.DisplayName" value="My Organization"/> <propertycopy name="displayName" from="org.${org}.DisplayName"/>
